decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing efficient and powerful creatures in the early game. The aim is to control the board and deal damage quickly to win the game before the opponent can stabilize. By combining powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Elder Gargaroth with combat tricks like Primal Might and Decisive Denial, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Scavenging Ooze provides additional support and card advantage to maintain the aggression.

The primary focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional synergy and value to the deck. By managing resources effectively and carefully planning plays, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through a combination of card advantage and powerful finishers like Alrund's Epiphany and Shark Typhoon. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also providing consistency and flexibility.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and removal cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana and gaining card advantage. The deck also utilizes Emergent Ultimatum to search for powerful threats and spells, allowing the player to potentially win the game on the spot. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra value. The deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Elspeth's Nightmare.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with small, low-cost creatures like Alseid of Life's Bounty, Giant Killer, and Luminarch Aspirant while disrupting their strategy with cards like Elite Spellbinder and Skyclave Apparition. The main goal is to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent with a constant stream of threats, utilizing the snow lands for additional support. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for further flexibility and resilience in the face of removal spells or board wipes.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Cycling mechanic to quickly draw through the deck and power up the Zenith Flare finisher. By playing cheap Cycling creatures like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, the deck can quickly cycle through cards and deal damage. Valiant Rescuer provides more Cycling triggers and Irencrag Pyromancer offers additional burn damage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Memory Leak and Drannith Healer to disrupt opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of Cycling triggers and finish them off with a massive Zenith Flare.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and disrupting their strategy while setting up for powerful late-game plays with cards like Alrund's Epiphany and Goldspan Dragon. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, removal, and versatile creatures to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells. The overall goal is to outsmart and outmaneuver the opponent using a combination of control elements and powerful finishers.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with targeted removal spells, and generating card advantage through card draw and mana ramp. The win condition relies on powerful dragons like Goldspan Dragon and Alrund's Epiphany to overwhelm the opponent, while also having disruptive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower to stall the game. The inclusion of snow lands and Faceless Haven adds versatility and resilience to the deck, allowing for different game plans depending on the matchup.

The deck focuses on building a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a mix of powerful creatures and spell cards. By utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring, the deck gains access to additional resources and flexibility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, along with disruptive cards like Elite Spellbinder and Giant Killer. Showdown of the Skalds can provide a big burst of power, while Kabira Takedown offers removal. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent.

This Izzet Control deck focuses on using spells and creatures to control the game and slow down the opponent's strategy. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and powerful dragons like Goldspan Dragon, the deck aims to maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Magma Opus, Brazen Borrower, and Faceless Haven provide versatility in dealing with threats while keeping the opponent on the defensive. By efficiently managing resources and utilizing card advantage, this deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through strategic play.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering spells and removing threats while generating card advantage with cards like Expressive Iteration and Alrund's Epiphany. Using powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Galazeth Prismari to close out the game or generate mana advantage. The deck also incorporates lands that can produce multiple colors of mana to cast spells of different color requirements. The goal is to stall the game out until the opponent runs out of resources and then finish them off with powerful finishers.

This Jeskai Combo deck utilizes a combination of card advantage, tempo plays, and powerful creatures to generate a winning board state. The deck focuses on casting cheap spells to trigger Jeskai combo pieces like Vadrok, Apex of Thunder and Lore Drakkis, while also protecting key cards with counterspells like Miscast and Unsubstantiate. Expressive Iteration helps to filter through the deck for combo pieces, while Goldspan Dragon provides a powerful threat and mana acceleration. The deck aims to control the game early and then combo off for a powerful finish.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and powerful equipment, while also utilizing Snow lands for additional synergy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Fervent Champion and Bonecrusher Giant, supported by Torbran's damage-boosting ability. Embercleave serves as a powerful finisher to end the game quickly. The inclusion of snow lands allows for consistent access to Frost Bite and Faceless Haven for additional removal and creature threats.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to control the game through card advantage, removal, counterspells, and board wipes. By utilizing cards like Curate, Rain of Revelation, and Thirst for Knowledge to draw cards, along with removal spells like Heartless Act, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents. Professor Onyx provides additional card advantage and removal, while Shark Typhoon and Alrund's Epiphany can generate threats and card advantage. Titans' Nest helps ramp up mana for powerful late-game plays, while Mystical Dispute offers protection against opposing spells.

The main idea of this deck is to use a combination of control spells and powerful creatures to dominate the game. By utilizing cards like Drown in the Loch, Cling to Dust, and Negate to control the opponent's plays, while also ramping up with Cultivate and mana fixing with the various pathways, the deck aims to stabilize the board until it can drop big threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Elder Gargaroth to seal the victory. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as an additional value engine and allows for extra card advantage with its blinking ability.

This deck focuses on generating card advantage and controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and powerful threats. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for extra value by flickering permanents with enter-the-battlefield effects. Emergent Ultimatum serves as a key card for tutoring powerful spells from the deck, giving the player flexibility in choosing the best cards for any given situation. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through card advantage and efficient removal, while also presenting strong win conditions in the form of powerful creatures and game-ending spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and cards with high value to outvalue opponents. It aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck. The deck also includes a variety of ramp spells to ensure it can cast its high-cost spells. Overall, the deck aims to grind out games and win through overwhelming card advantage and control.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy using various control spells while utilizing cards that synergize with each other to mill the opponent's deck. Its main goal is to maintain board control by removing threats and countering spells, while also enabling the mill win condition through cards like Ruin Crab and into the Story. By combining efficient removal spells with powerful mill effects, this deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and ultimately deplete their library to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful spells, removal, and high-impact creatures. By using cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ox of Agonas to outvalue the opponent, along with disruptive counterspells like Jwari Disruption and Draconic Intervention, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while generating significant card advantage. The deck also includes efficient removal options in Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to handle threats on the board. Additionally, the deck can close out games quickly with powerful finishers like Goldspan Dragon and Magma Opus.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively cycle through cards using cards like Flourishing Fox and Zenith Flare to deal damage quickly. Valiant Rescuer and Drannith Stinger are key creatures that benefit from cycling, while Irencrag Pyromancer provides additional damage. Improbable Alliance generates tokens to apply early pressure, while Frostveil Ambush can function as both removal and a cycling option. The deck also includes some counter spells for protection. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced cycling strategy and finish them off with a powerful Zenith Flare.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of cheap cycling creatures and spells in order to quickly build up a large hand size and cycle through the deck efficiently. This allows the player to take advantage of cards like Rielle, the Everwise and Zenith Flare to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a short amount of time. The key strategy is to cycle through the deck as quickly as possible to build up resources and then unleash a powerful finishing blow with Zenith Flare.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to create a board presence and buffing up creatures with the Zenith Flare finisher. Using cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger to chip away at the opponent's life total while maintaining card advantage through cycling. With the help of cards like Improbable Alliance, the deck can quickly flood the board with tokens for aggressive plays. The combination of cycling and aggressive creatures gives this deck the ability to quickly overwhelm opponents and close out games.

This deck focuses on utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring to have a consistent mana base and efficient curve. The deck is built around aggressive creatures like Giant Killer and Bonecrusher Giant, supported by cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Showdown of the Skalds for card advantage and additional threats. The inclusion of Shepherd of the Flock and Kabira Takedown also provides some flexibility and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to swarm the board with powerful creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Elite Spellbinder.

The main focus of this deck is to be aggressive and maintain a strong board presence using creatures with powerful abilities. With cards like Giant Killer, Elite Spellbinder, and Lovestruck Beast, you can control the opponent's board while dealing consistent damage. Showdown of the Skalds can provide a burst of creatures and power to overwhelm your opponent quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and versatility to the deck. With a mixture of removal, card advantage, and evasion, this deck aims to pressure your opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with low-cost creatures and sacrifice effects to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The use of cards like Claim the Firstborn and Immersturm Predator allows for stealing the opponent's creatures and sacrificing them for additional value. The inclusion of cards like Plumb the Forbidden and Village Rites helps to draw additional cards and maintain momentum in the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature pressure and disruptive plays to secure victory.

The main theme of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and sacrifice synergies to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By combining cards that allow you to steal your opponent's creatures, sacrifice your own for value, and create token creatures to trigger various effects, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and control the pace of the game. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Kroxa and Rankle, along with sacrifice outlets like Village Rites and Plumb the Forbidden, enables the deck to continuously apply pressure and outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play aggressive red creatures and boost their damage output with cards like Torbran, Fervent Champion, and Embercleave. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain it throughout by utilizing fast, powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Anax. The inclusion of snow lands and Faceless Haven provides additional versatility and evasion options. Overall, the deck is designed to hit hard and fast, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay using powerful red creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Key cards such as Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave provide additional damage and combat tricks, while cards like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Phoenix of Ash can create resilient threats. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for additional synergy with Frost Bite and Faceless Haven, giving the deck versatility in dealing with different types of threats. Overall, the deck aims to end the game as quickly as possible through aggressive creature attacks and direct damage spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. The goal is to deal as much damage as possible in the early turns of the game, utilizing cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave to maximize damage output. Utilizing the snow lands for Frost Bite and Faceless Haven adds flexibility and additional sources of damage. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with efficient removal spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and efficient burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage early and often, using cards like Torbran to amplify the damage output of red spells and creatures. Embercleave provides additional burst damage and helps finish off opponents. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for the use of Frost Bite as a cheap and effective removal spell. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure and defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, backed up by counterspells like Negate and Mystical Dispute. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. The deck also uses ramp spells like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to accelerate into powerful threats like Vorinclex and Elder Gargaroth. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for flexibility in the deck's game plan, ensuring that it can adapt to a variety of matchups and strategies.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Heartless Act and Extinction Event. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with powerful threats like Elder Gargaroth and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider, while also utilizing powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum to search for key cards in the deck. With the addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck can create even more value by flickering permanents like Omen of the Sea and Binding the Old Gods.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and versatile threats to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. By including a companion in Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck gains access to additional card advantage and versatility. The deck is packed with removal options like Heartless Act and Extinction Event, along with powerful finishers like Kiora Bests the Sea God and Emergent Ultimatum. With a solid mana base and a mix of threats and answers, this deck aims to control the game and grind out incremental advantages to secure victory.
